runs.comm: nice friendly delivery to start with, short and wide, Hales drives it square through the off side
width again, but this time it comes off the edge down to third man
full on the stumps, squared up a touch and takes a thick outside edge towards backward point
swing and miss, comes down the pitch and tries to pull but is done by a lack of pace
back of a length and worked to midwicket
a beauty to end the over, nips back off the seam and cuts Hales in half as it beats the inside edge
starts down the leg side and that's an easy wide call
low full toss which is pushed to mid-on
on leg stump, easily flicked away down to fine leg...Edwards hasn't got his line yet
this time he oversteps, the ball is defended back to Edwards and we'll have a free hit next
that's big! Back of a length, Kieswetter moves to leg a touch then launches it miles into the night sky and it has enough legs to clear the midwicket boundary
good comeback, tight on middle stump, solidly defended
full on off stump, Kieswetter comes forward and defends to backward point
ooh, fairly close leave as the ball scoots close to off stump. Good judgement
decent start on off stump, defended into the off side
very wide outside off, even Hales with his long reach can't get it
the bowler gets away with this, it was on leg stump and Hales flicked it sweetly but straight to short fine-leg
good length outside off and left alone...England not under much run-rate pressure
driven on the up into the covers and the fielder is deep enough for an easy single
well bowled, slower-ball yorker which is dug out by Hales into the off side
oh dear, a horrid misfield at mid-off gifts a boundary to Hales. It was a forcing shot off the back foot and it burst through the fielder's legs
back of a length outside off, Kieswetter opens the face and a fumble at third man allows him back for a second...very alert from the batsmen
full and straight, comes right across the crease and works it down to mid-on
flicks off the pads to short fine-leg
tries to launch this out of The Oval, but ends up getting an edge into his pads
turned along the ground through square leg...oh boy, another fumble, this time by the keeper, means they take another
full on middle, defended back to the bowler
that's a lovely shot, full delivery and Hales flicked it away wide of mid-on with excellent timing
drags the length back and worked out to deep square
goes for the pull but gets a bottom edge into his body which bobbles to the ground
this is quick, 92mph, but it's another no-ball
it's full, Kieswetter tries to flog it over the leg side and it comes off a thick outer part of the bat and flies over the off side
touch of extra bounce but it's well played as he flicks it past short fine-leg
finishes with a bouncer and Hales ducks
back of a length, worked into the leg side
on leg stump, pushed out to deep midwicket
gentle medium pace on a length, gently defended to the off side
gives himself a hint of room then drives firmly to mid-off but it's still an easy single
out comes the scope, goes down on one knee and flicks it over short fine-leg
wide outside off, comes forward and opens the face to send it wide of third man
bunted firmly off the back foot through midwicket and nicely placed
waits for this and opens the face through backward point...it's too easy
pulled down short and Hales latches on as he helps it over the backward square-leg boundary...was always aiming for six
goes full this time and it's drilled to cover
dragged down very short, attempted slower ball, Hales helps himself to a few more as he pulls it behind square square
pushed firmly to cover again
starts with some width, Kieswetter slams it square and there's an excellent stop to prevent a boundary
pushed through the covers
comes out very short, Kieswetter waits and waits then places it wide of long on
short again, a flat-batted pull down the ground
struggling with his length here, Hales sweeps from well outside off in front of square
that's better, a skidder that zips into Kieswetter and almost cramps him for room as he chops to short third-man
plenty of width and Kieswetter throws his hands through a cut which is cut off by third man
tighter to the batsman this time but Kieswetter calmly guides it to third man
worked off the pads
tries to pull through the leg side, not quite short enough and it drills towards square leg off a bottom edge
tucked round the corner to long leg
slower ball, although it's relative, and punched off the back foot down the ground
quicker ball which is pushed to cover
cut away through the off side
waits for this outside off then whips the bat quickly through a cut shot
down the leg side, will have to be bowled again
goes for the pull but miscues it straight back to the bowler
easy pickings as another short ball is pulled through square leg
a lack of pace almost defeats Hales as this takes a toe end back down the pitch
good grief, what a start. Horrid delivery, a half-track long-hop no-ball. Oh dear
another long-hop, and this one is heaved out into the deep. Bonner looks really nervous
clipped away for another, Bonner giving the ball absolutely no air
short of off stump, Hales swipes but can't get this away
Bonner is getting very little work on the ball and has consistently bowled long hops through this over. This one is cracked out to deep square, and they're back for the second
a touch of spin away, slashed out to deep cover
this is the first delivery to come close to landing on a good length, it rushes on with the arm and is driven to long on
at the other end, Bishoo has made a good start to his second over, tossing one up outside off and fizzing the ball past Kieswetter's outside edge
floated up nicely full again, and spinning away as Kieswetter thrusts his pad out to leave
punched down to long on for one

a scooped sweep loops down to long leg, where Edwards charges round and skids to stop it ... He pulls the ball back in time, but his leg touched the ball while his body was in contact with the boundary, so that's four
and another! Hales nails a sweep out into the deep to go to his maiden international fifty. Well played!
third sweep in a row from Hales, and Edwards does well to stop this one and get the ball back in quickly
Bonner is really struggling here. Another long-hop. Another no-ball ...
huge! There was major airtime on this shot from Kieswetter. He skipped down the track and lifted it handsomely straight back over the helpless Bonner's head
slashed out behind point
finally, Bonner tosses one up, and Hales nudges into the leg side for one
nicely full again, the ball takes the inner half of the bat and rolls to square leg
Hales bends into yet another sweep, but can't connect with this one
tossed up on off stump. Hales hangs back to ping the man at extra cover
Kieswetter waits and waits, and then chops daintily to get the ball to short third man
quicker and flatter through the air, Hales easing the ball down to long off
Kieswetter lunges forward with bat and pad tightly together to keep this one out
Kieswetter plays late and with soft hands to find a single behind point
Hales seemed to be readying himself for a mow here, but it was nicely tossed up and he eventually opted for defence ... but oh no, now Bishoo has over-stepped!
Hales has an almighty heave to leg and gets nowhere close, Bishoo having fired this one in fast and flat
slower through the air to end the over, and it's swept out to the man at deep square
Barnwell hustles in and hits a good length straight away, Hales defending
good bowling again from Barnwell, and Hales can't put him away
flicked off the pads for one
both batsman are just having a look here, there's a definite 10-wicket win on the cards now
chopped down on the off side for a single
just two runs to win now, as Hales swivels on one leg to pull a slower ball past the man at short fine leg
good start from him, Kieswetter having to dig out a pinpoint yorker
a shovelled drive flies through cover, and that's the game!
